Info: Mphasis offers a range of services, including application development, infrastructure services, business process outsourcing, and consulting. They work with clients in the financial services, telecom, logistics, and technology industries. Mphasis is headquartered in Bengaluru, India. They also operate in the US, the UK, Germany, Belgium, and France.  Mphasis was incorporated on August 10, 1992. In 2016, Hewlett Packard Enterprise sold the majority of its stake in Mphasis to Blackstone Group LP.
Round 1: Aptitude and logical reasoning assessment: This round may be a HackerRank test that includes questions on English and logical thinking
Round 2: Group discussion: In this round, a random topic is given for discussion
Round 3: Technical round: This round may include questions on basics like method overloading, string concepts, file handling, and basics of HTML and CSS.
Round 4: One-on-one round: This round may include questions on client handling related queries, handling priority tasks, and handling a team.
column9: Voice Versant Test: This test may judge your English speaking skills

Info: Hexaware Technologies is a global IT and business process outsourcing (BPO) services company founded in 1990 by Atul K. Mehta. Headquartered in Navi Mumbai, India, Hexaware specializes in providing IT solutions across various industries, including banking, financial services, healthcare, and retail. The company offers services such as cloud computing, digital transformation, application development, testing, and business process outsourcing. Hexaware is known for its expertise in automation, artificial intelligence, and machine learning, helping organizations improve operational efficiency and enhance customer experience. The company has a strong global presence, with offices in over 20 countries.
Round 1: Written test: This test assesses the applicant's aptitude, communication, and logical skills. The test may include questions from computer science, English, logic, and aptitude.
Round 2: Technical interview: This interview tests the applicant's theoretical knowledge. The interview may include questions about DBMS, OOPS, programming languages, operating systems, and computer networking.
Round 3: HR interview: This interview assesses the applicant's mental performance and ability to handle critical situations. The interview may include basic HR-related questions.

Info: Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) is a global IT services and consulting company founded in 1968 by Faquir Chand Kohli as part of the Tata Group, with its headquarters located in Mumbai, India. TCS offers a wide range of services including IT consulting, software development, business solutions, and outsourcing to industries such as banking, finance, healthcare, retail, and telecommunications. As one of the largest IT services companies in the world, TCS is known for its expertise in digital transformation, cloud services, AI, and machine learning. TCS has a strong global presence, serving clients in over 46 countries and employing hundreds of thousands of professionals. The company's commitment to innovation and quality has made it a leader in the IT sector.
Round 1: Aptitude test: A 90-minute test that includes sections on quantitative aptitude and programming language efficiency
Round 2: Technical interview: A face-to-face round that assesses your knowledge of data structures, algorithms, database management systems, operating systems, networking, and object-oriented programming. You might be asked to write code on paper.
Round 3: Managerial interview: This round tests your problem-solving approach, teamwork, and ability to handle real-world scenarios. You might be asked general technical and HR questions, or your interviewer might try to gauge your reactions.
Round 4: HR interview: This round asks questions about your work experience, education, hobbies, and family background. You might also be asked about your strengths and weaknesses, reasons for applying to the company, and why you should be hired.

Info: Cognizant Technology Solutions is a multinational IT services and consulting company founded in 1994 by Kumar Mahadeva and Francisco D'Souza, with its headquarters located in Teaneck, New Jersey, USA. Initially started as a division of Dun & Bradstreet, Cognizant became an independent company focused on providing IT services, consulting, and outsourcing solutions to various industries, including healthcare, finance, retail, and manufacturing. The company offers services in areas such as digital transformation, cloud computing, AI, data analytics, and automation. Cognizant is known for its commitment to innovation and delivering high-quality solutions, and it has established a strong global presence, employing hundreds of thousands of professionals worldwide.
Round 1: Communication assessment: This round may include reading and grammar, and comprehension and listening sections.
Round 2: Aptitude and technical assessment: This round may include an online coding test and a technical round.
Round 3: Technical interview: This round may be in-person and may include technical questions about data structures, algorithms, and core subjects.
Round 4: HR round: This round may include conventional HR questions.

Info: IBM (International Business Machines Corporation) is a multinational technology company founded in 1911 by Charles Ranlett Flint as the Computing-Tabulating-Recording Company (CTR) and later renamed to IBM in 1924. Headquartered in Armonk, New York, IBM is one of the oldest and largest technology companies globally. The company is known for its innovations in hardware, software, and consulting services. It has been a leader in areas such as mainframe computing, artificial intelligence (AI), cloud computing, quantum computing, and blockchain technology. IBM is particularly recognized for its development of Watson, an AI platform, and its contributions to enterprise-level technology solutions. Over the years, IBM has transformed into a hybrid cloud and AI-focused business, with a strong presence in various industries, including finance, healthcare, and government.
Round 1: Online assessment:  A written aptitude test with questions on topics like number series, quant, English language, and grammar A cognitive ability test An English assessment test that's a text-based multiple-choice assessment
Round 2: Technical interview rounds: This interview tests the applicant's theoretical knowledge. The interview may include questions about DBMS, OOPS, programming languages, operating systems, and computer networking.
Round 3: HR interview: This interview assesses the applicant's mental performance and ability to handle critical situations. The interview may include basic HR-related questions.

Info: Capgemini is a global leader in consulting, technology services, and digital transformation, founded in 1967 by Serge Kampf in Paris, France. The company offers a broad range of services, including IT consulting, cloud solutions, data analytics, artificial intelligence, and cybersecurity, serving industries like financial services, manufacturing, retail, and telecommunications. Capgemini helps businesses navigate their digital transformation by providing innovative and technology-driven solutions that improve efficiency, agility, and customer experience. The company has a strong global presence, with operations in over 50 countries, employing hundreds of thousands of professionals. Capgemini is known for its commitment to sustainable development and is a major player in the IT and consulting sectors.
Round 1: Online assessment: A written exam that may be required for freshers
Round 2: Coding assessment: A test that evaluates a candidate's technical knowledge

Round 5: Technical interviews: An interview that evaluates a candidate's technical skills

Info: Wipro Limited is a global information technology, consulting, and business process services company, founded in 1945 by M.H. Hasham Premji in Mumbai, India. Originally established as a vegetable oil manufacturer, Wipro diversified into the IT industry in the 1980s under the leadership of Azim Premji, transforming into one of India's largest IT services companies. Wipro offers a wide range of services, including IT consulting, cloud solutions, digital transformation, data analytics, and cybersecurity, serving industries such as banking, healthcare, retail, and manufacturing. With a strong global presence, Wipro operates in over 50 countries and is known for its innovation, commitment to sustainability, and focus on leveraging cutting-edge technologies like artificial intelligence and automation to deliver value to its clients.
Round 1: Online assessment: The first step in the process, this round includes an aptitude test, coding, and essay writing: Aptitude test: Includes sections on quantitative skills, logical reasoning, and communication ability Coding: For technical candidates, this round typically includes 2-3 easy coding questions Essay writing: Candidates may be asked to write an essay on any topic or event
Round 2: Technical interview: Candidates who pass the online assessment are invited to this round, which can be face-to-face or via video call. Interviewers ask questions related to the candidate's job profile.
Round 3: HR interview: This round assesses whether the candidate is a good fit for the organization.

Info: HCL Technologies is a multinational IT services and consulting company founded in 1976 by Shiv Nadar in Noida, India. Initially, HCL started as a hardware company but later shifted its focus to software services and IT solutions, becoming one of India's leading technology firms. The company offers a wide range of services, including IT consulting, enterprise solutions, cloud computing, cybersecurity, and digital transformation. HCL serves industries such as aerospace, automotive, banking, financial services, and healthcare. With a global presence in over 40 countries, HCL is recognized for its innovation in technologies like artificial intelligence, automation, and blockchain. The company's commitment to delivering cutting-edge solutions has established it as a key player in the global IT services market.
Round 1: Aptitude assessment: This round includes questions about logical reasoning, mathematics, verbal skills, and technical grasp. The HCL CAT is an aptitude test that evaluates a candidate's analytical, quantitative, logical, verbal, and technical skills.
Round 2: Group discussion: This round assesses a candidate's presence of mind and confidence level. Topics are usually on general or social topics of national importance.
Round 3: Technical interview: This round assesses a candidate's technical skills.
Round 4: HR round: This round is an interview with the human resources department.

Info: Infosys is a multinational technology company founded in 1981 by N. R. Narayana Murthy and six other engineers in Pune, India. Headquartered in Bengaluru, India, Infosys is a global leader in IT consulting, software development, and business process outsourcing. The company provides a wide range of services, including cloud computing, artificial intelligence, machine learning, digital transformation, and cybersecurity, across industries such as finance, healthcare, manufacturing, and retail. Infosys is known for its strong focus on innovation, client-centric solutions, and its commitment to sustainability. It has a significant global presence, with operations in over 50 countries, and is recognized as one of India's largest IT services companies.
Round 1: Online aptitude test: The first round, which candidates must pass to be eligible for the next rounds
Round 2: Technical interview: Focuses on core skills, such as: Algorithms and data structures At least one programming language OOPS, DBMS, CN, and OS Coding and problem-solving Puzzles and aptitude-based questions Emerging technologies
Round 3: Managerial round: Assesses leadership, problem-solving abilities, and cultural fit
Round 4: HR interview: The final step, which assesses overall personality and suitability for the role

Info: Zoho Corporation is a multinational software company founded in 1996 by Sridhar Vembu and Tony Thomas, with its headquarters located in Chennai, India. Initially starting as a provider of IT solutions and cloud-based software, Zoho has grown to become a leading developer of software products for businesses, including tools for customer relationship management (CRM), project management, finance, HR, and collaboration. Zoho's suite of over 45 integrated applications is widely used by businesses of all sizes to streamline their operations and improve productivity. The company is known for its strong emphasis on innovation, data privacy, and user-centric solutions. Zoho has a global presence with offices in various countries, and it is recognized for offering affordable and scalable software solutions, especially for small and medium-sized enterprises (SMEs).
Round 1: Written test: A 90-minute test with multiple choice questions (MCQs) on general aptitude and programming aptitude. Freshers are required to take an aptitude test.
Round 2: Basic programming: A one-on-one test where candidates are given questions in chat. Candidates should have a good understanding of data structures and algorithms.
Round 3: Advanced programming: A round with one or two questions that test critical thinking skills. Candidates should know data structures and algorithms.
Round 4: Design round: An optional round for freshers where candidates are asked to design a system.
Round 5: Technical HR: A round with technical questions based on data structures, Java, and logical apps. The number of technical HR rounds may vary depending on the candidate's performance in the previous HR rounds.
Round 6: General HR: A round with HR questions about the candidate's background, skills, and hobbies.

Info: Mindtree is a global technology consulting and services company founded in 1999 by a group of IT professionals, including Subroto Bagchi and others, with its headquarters in Bangalore, India. Mindtree offers a wide range of services, including IT consulting, digital transformation, cloud computing, data analytics, artificial intelligence, and enterprise resource planning (ERP) solutions. The company serves various industries, including banking, financial services, retail, manufacturing, and healthcare. Known for its agile approach and innovative solutions, Mindtree focuses on delivering customer-centric services that drive business growth. In 2019, Mindtree became a part of the Larsen & Toubro (L&T) Group, which further strengthened its capabilities and global reach. Mindtree operates in over 20 countries and is recognized for its strong commitment to sustainability and corporate social responsibility.
Round 1: Written test: An online test that may include aptitude, logical reasoning, verbal ability, and coding sections
Round 2: Technical interview: A technical interview round
Round 3: HR interview: An HR interview round

Info: Renault-Nissan-Mitsubishi Alliance is a strategic partnership between three global automotive manufacturers: Renault (France), Nissan (Japan), and Mitsubishi Motors (Japan). The alliance was formed in 1999, primarily driven by the vision of Carlos Ghosn, who was instrumental in creating a cooperative framework for the three companies to share resources, technologies, and costs while maintaining their individual identities. The collaboration focuses on mutual benefits such as research and development, vehicle production, and purchasing. The Alliance has enabled the companies to create a wide range of innovative vehicles, from electric cars like the Nissan Leaf to cutting-edge autonomous driving technologies. Today, the Renault-Nissan-Mitsubishi Alliance operates in more than 200 countries, making it one of the largest automotive groups in the world.
Round 1: Online test: A 60-minute test with 50 questions on topics like computer fundamentals, Java, C++, and aptitude
Round 2: Technical HR: A 50-minute round that covers topics like projects, SQL, DBMS, Java, and DSA
Round 3: General HR: A 20-minute round that covers topics like project communication, strengths/weaknesses, goals, and confidence

Info: Virtusa Corporation is a global IT services and consulting company founded in 1996 by Dr. Kris Canekeratne and others, with its headquarters located in Southborough, Massachusetts, USA. Virtusa provides a range of services, including IT consulting, digital transformation, software engineering, cloud computing, artificial intelligence, data analytics, and enterprise solutions. The company serves various industries, including banking, financial services, healthcare, telecommunications, and retail. Virtusa is known for its expertise in helping organizations accelerate their digital journey by delivering innovative and efficient solutions. With a global presence in over 25 countries, Virtusa is recognized for its focus on quality, customer satisfaction, and fostering long-term client relationships.
Round 1: Online assessment: This round includes an aptitude section, web and technical section, verbal ability and communication, and two coding rounds. The time limit for this round is usually three hours.
Round 2: Technical interview: This round is usually a one-to-one interview that assesses the candidate's technical knowledge and proficiency in areas like programming languages, database technologies, and software development methodologies.
Round 3: Group discussion: This round can sometimes be skipped. In this round, a team of 10 members is given a topic to discuss for at least five minutes.
Round 4: HR interview: This round focuses on behavioral and personality traits to determine if the candidate is compatible with the organization's culture and values.

Info: Atos is a multinational IT services and consulting company founded in 1997 and headquartered in Bezons, France. Atos serves industries such as financial services, healthcare, manufacturing, and public sector organizations. Info: NTT Data is a global IT service provider and consulting company, founded in 1988 as a subsidiary of the Japanese telecommunications giant NTT (Nippon Telegraph and Telephone Corporation). Headquartered in Tokyo, Japan, NTT Data offers a wide range of services, including IT consulting, cloud computing, digital transformation, application development, and systems integration. The company serves various industries, including banking, healthcare, manufacturing, telecommunications, and public sector organizations. NTT Data is known for its strong focus on innovation, customer-centric solutions, and leveraging emerging technologies such as artificial intelligence, big data, and cybersecurity. With a presence in over 50 countries, NTT Data is recognized as one of the leading IT services providers globally, helping organizations optimize their business operations and navigate the challenges of digital transformation.

Info: Goldman Sachs is a leading global investment banking, securities, and investment management firm, founded in 1869 by Marcus Goldman in New York City. The company provides a wide range of financial services, including mergers and acquisitions (M&A) advisory, asset management, securities trading, investment banking, and private equity. Goldman Sachs serves a diverse client base, including corporations, financial institutions, governments, and individuals. Known for its expertise in financial markets, Goldman Sachs is recognized for its strong presence in investment banking and its role in major financial transactions globally. The company is also known for its commitment to innovation in financial services, leveraging advanced technologies like artificial intelligence and machine learning to enhance decision-making and investment strategies. With a global presence, Goldman Sachs continues to be one of the most influential and prestigious firms in the financial industry.
Round 1: Aptitude test: A round for freshers in engineering roles
Round 2: HackerRank assessment: An assessment for engineering applicants
Round 3: Coderpad round: A live coding round where the candidate shares their screen with the interviewer
Round 4: Telephonic round: A round where the interviewer asks questions about the candidate's course or technologies from their resume
Round 5: Technical interview: A face-to-face interview where the interviewer asks questions about the candidate's projects, technologies, training, and internships

Maventic works with industries such as healthcare, finance, retail, and manufacturing to offer tailored technology solutions that meet specific business needs. Although its specific founding details and global presence may vary, the company is known for its customer-centric approach and its ability to deliver impactful digital solutions.
Round 1: Technical round: This round may include questions about both frontend and backend, such as how APIs work and writing code for APIs.

Info: Deloitte is one of the "Big Four" professional services firms, offering a wide range of services including audit, tax, consulting, risk advisory, and financial advisory. Founded in 1845 by William Welch Deloitte in London, the company has grown to become a global leader in professional services. Deloitte operates in over 150 countries, serving clients across industries such as financial services, healthcare, technology, energy, and government. The company is renowned for its expertise in helping businesses with digital transformation, strategy, mergers and acquisitions, and technology consulting, using advanced technologies like artificial intelligence, blockchain, and data analytics. Deloitte also provides cutting-edge solutions for cybersecurity, regulatory compliance, and risk management. The firm is known for its commitment to innovation and a client-centric approach, providing tailored solutions to address complex business challenges.
Round 1: Online assessment: This is a screening test that includes psychometric tests such as numerical reasoning, verbal reasoning, and situational judgment. The Deloitte online assessment is also known as the Deloitte immersive online assessment.
Round 2: Interview: The interview process can include a telephonic screening, a face-to-face interview, or a combination of both. The interview can be technical, a panel interview, or a case study interview. The interview may also include a group discussion.
Round 3: Final interview: This interview is typically with a Director or Partner from the business area you applied to. This interview will discuss your experience and skills, and explore your potential career path at Deloitte.

Info: Flipkart is a leading Indian e-commerce company founded in 2007 by Sachin Bansal and Binny Bansal, both former Amazon employees. Headquartered in Bengaluru, India, Flipkart started as an online bookstore and later expanded into a wide range of product categories, including electronics, fashion, home goods, and groceries. Over the years, Flipkart has become one of the largest online retailers in India, offering a comprehensive shopping experience through its website and mobile apps. The company is known for its customer-centric approach, with services like easy returns, secure payment options, and quick delivery. Flipkart was acquired by Walmart in 2018, which has further strengthened its position in the Indian market. Flipkart is a key player in the rapidly growing Indian e-commerce industry and is committed to expanding its reach and improving its technological infrastructure to provide better services to its customers.
Round 1: Online coding round: This round may be hosted on Hackerrank and includes a few coding questions. The questions may be based on topics like recursion, strings, trees, and graphs.
Round 2: Technical interview: This round may include algorithmic problems based on data structures like graphs, matrices, and strings.
Round 3: Machine coding round: In this round, candidates are given a problem and are expected to write a complete working code within a time limit.
Round 4: Problem solving and data structures round: This round focuses on data structures and algorithms, and may include questions on topics like string manipulation, searching, sorting, and backtracking.
Round 5: System design round: This round is only for senior positions and involves solving and discussing a design problem.
Round 6: HR round: This round may include questions about achievements, moments of pride, and instances of failure.

Info: PayPal is a global online payment platform founded in December 1998 by Max Levchin, Peter Thiel, and Luke Nosek under the name Confinity, later rebranded to PayPal in 2001. Headquartered in San Jose, California, PayPal enables individuals and businesses to make secure payments and money transfers online. It provides a digital wallet for storing payment methods, facilitating transactions for goods, services, and peer-to-peer transfers. PayPal has become a widely used solution for e-commerce, offering features like fraud protection, international payments, and integration with other financial services. As of today, PayPal operates in over 200 markets globally, supporting various currencies and serving millions of active users worldwide.
Round 1: Online test: Usually conducted on Hackerrank, this round consists of two questions with 14 test cases each
Round 2: Technical interview 1: This round lasts for an hour and consists of coding questions
Round 3: Technical interview 2: This round also lasts for an hour and consists of questions based on your resume, such as algorithms and data structures
Round 4: Managerial round: This round lasts for about 45 minutes and consists of a mix of technical and behavioral questions

Info: Tata Group is a multinational conglomerate headquartered in Mumbai, India, founded in 1868 by Jamsetji Tata. It operates in various sectors, including steel, automotive, telecommunications, information technology, consumer products, and energy. The group’s flagship companies include Tata Steel, Tata Motors, Tata Consultancy Services (TCS), and Tata Power, among others. Tata Group is known for its ethical business practices, commitment to social responsibility, and contribution to India's industrialization. The company has a significant global presence, with operations in more than 100 countries. Tata Group is recognized for its strong focus on sustainability, innovation, and building long-term value for its stakeholders.
Round 1: Aptitude test: An online test with multiple choice questions that may include aptitude, logical reasoning, and technical questions

Round 4: Coding test: A test that may ask how a product solved a client's problem

Round 6: Final interview: A face-to-face interaction with senior leaders

Info: Flextronics, now known as Flex, is a global electronics manufacturing services (EMS) company founded in 1969 by Joe McKenzie in Silicon Valley, California. The company provides design, engineering, manufacturing, and supply chain solutions to a wide range of industries, including automotive, healthcare, consumer electronics, industrial, and telecommunications. Flex offers end-to-end services, from product concept and design to prototyping, manufacturing, and after-market support. The company is known for its innovation in electronics and advanced manufacturing technologies, such as automation, IoT, and digital transformation. With operations in over 30 countries, Flex is a key player in the global electronics supply chain, helping companies scale their products and achieve operational efficiency.

Info: Volvo Group is a multinational manufacturing company founded in 1927 and headquartered in Gothenburg, Sweden. It is primarily known for producing heavy-duty vehicles, including trucks, buses, construction equipment, and marine and industrial engines. Volvo operates in various industries, including transportation, construction, and energy. Round 2: Round 2: A group discussion.
Round 3: Round 3: A technical interview that may include coding and questions about technical subjects.
Round 4: Round 4: An HR interview.

Info: Revature is a technology talent development and consulting company that focuses on training and deploying software engineers for leading companies across various industries. Founded in 2003, Revature specializes in providing large-scale, customized training programs that help individuals, particularly those with little to no prior experience in software development, acquire the skills needed to work in the tech industry. The company offers intensive training in areas such as software engineering, full-stack development, and data analytics, using both instructor-led and self-paced learning models. Revature partners with corporations to help meet their demand for skilled tech professionals by providing them with a pool of trained engineers. Through its innovative model, Revature has helped bridge the skills gap in the technology workforce, delivering a high volume of tech talent for its clients. With a focus on continuous learning and professional development, Revature has established itself as a prominent player in the talent development space for the tech industry.
Round 1: Online assessment: The first step in the interview process is an online assessment.
Round 2: Technical screening: After passing the online assessment, the next step is a technical screening.
Round 3: Client pre-selection: After the technical screening, the next step is client pre-selection.
Round 4: Training: After the client pre-selection, the next step is training, which can last up to two months.
Round 5: Client interview: After the training, the next step is a client interview.

Info: Byju's is an Indian edtech company founded in 2011 by Byju Raveendran. It offers a wide range of learning programs and educational content for students from kindergarten to competitive exam preparation. Initially launched as a mobile app for learning, Byju's has expanded to provide personalized, interactive learning experiences through video lessons, quizzes, and adaptive learning paths. The company is known for its innovative approach to education, integrating technology with teaching methods to create engaging and effective learning experiences. Byju's covers subjects like math, science, coding, and even test preparation for exams like JEE, NEET, and UPSC. With a global presence, Byju's has become one of the largest and most successful edtech companies in the world, focusing on making learning accessible, engaging, and fun.
Round 1: Aptitude test: A round that may include questions based on basics like math, chemistry, and physics.
Round 2: Group discussion: A round where shortlisted candidates debate a topic of social, national, or global importance. The goal is to assess a candidate's self-assuredness, skill, and foresight.
Round 3: Technical round: A round where candidates are asked questions about technical subjects.
Round 4: One-on-one interview: A common round in the interview process.
Round 5: HR round: A common round in the interview process.

Info: Hero MotoCorp is an Indian multinational motorcycle and scooter manufacturer, founded in 1984 as Hero Honda through a joint venture between the Hero Group and Honda. The company is headquartered in New Delhi, India, and is one of the largest manufacturers of motorcycles and scooters in the world. In 2011, Hero MotoCorp became an independent entity after Honda exited the joint venture. Hero is known for its affordable, fuel-efficient, and durable vehicles, with popular models such as the Hero Splendor, Hero HF Deluxe, and Hero Passion. The company offers a wide range of two-wheelers catering to different segments, from entry-level motorcycles to premium models. Hero MotoCorp has a strong presence in India and several other countries, and it is recognized for its commitment to innovation, sustainability, and community development. The company is also expanding its focus on electric vehicles, contributing to the global push for sustainable transportation.
Round 1: Written test: This may include aptitude, core mechanical engineering, English, quantitative, and logical reasoning questions
Round 2: Group discussion: This round may include a group elimination
Round 3: Interview: This round may include a combination of HR and technical questions. HR questions may include why you want to join the company, your future plans, and situation-based questions. Technical questions may be based on your favorite subject or other domains like metrology, material science, ED, and manufacturing processes.

Info: Genpact is a global professional services firm that provides digital transformation, business process outsourcing (BPO), and technology solutions. Founded in 1997 as a subsidiary of General Electric (GE), it became an independent company in 2005. Headquartered in New York, Genpact operates across various industries including banking, finance, insurance, healthcare, consumer goods, and manufacturing. The company specializes in leveraging technology, artificial intelligence, automation, and analytics to optimize business processes and drive operational efficiency for its clients. Genpact offers a wide range of services including finance and accounting, supply chain management, customer service, and risk management. It is recognized for its expertise in transforming complex business operations, helping organizations enhance their productivity, reduce costs, and improve decision-making. With a global workforce and a strong emphasis on innovation, Genpact is considered a leader in the digital transformation and business services sectors.
Round 1: Aptitude test: An online test that may be part of the interview process
Round 2: Group discussion: A round that may be part of the interview process
Round 3: Ops: The Operations Manager will assess your suitability for the process
Round 4: Technical or HR interview: The final round of the interview process

Info: DXC Technology is a global IT services and consulting company formed in 2017 through the merger of Computer Sciences Corporation (CSC) and the Enterprise Services division of Hewlett Packard Enterprise (HPE). Headquartered in Tysons, Virginia, DXC Technology provides a wide range of technology solutions, including cloud computing, IT infrastructure services, cybersecurity, enterprise resource planning (ERP), and digital transformation services. The company helps organizations navigate the digital landscape by offering services that improve business efficiency, enhance customer experiences, and enable innovation through the use of emerging technologies. DXC serves clients across various industries, including healthcare, financial services, energy, and public sector, and is known for its ability to deliver complex, large-scale IT solutions. The company combines deep industry expertise with cutting-edge technologies like artificial intelligence, automation, and data analytics to support clients in their digital transformation journeys. With a global presence, DXC is recognized as a leader in providing IT solutions and services.
Round 1: Coding and aptitude round: May include questions about SQL queries, API workaround, and cloud-based architecture
Round 2: Technical interview: Assesses the candidate's technical knowledge
Round 3: HR interview: Assesses the candidate's personality and soft skills

Info: KPMG (Klynveld Peat Marwick Goerdeler) is a global professional services firm providing audit, tax, and advisory services. Founded in 1987, KPMG operates in over 145 countries and is one of the "Big Four" accounting firms, alongside Deloitte, PwC, and EY. The firm serves a wide range of industries, including financial services, healthcare, energy, technology, and government. KPMG is known for its expertise in offering solutions related to risk management, regulatory compliance, mergers and acquisitions, and financial advisory. The company combines industry knowledge with advanced technologies to help clients navigate complex challenges and drive sustainable growth.
Round 1: Online assessment: A pre-screen that focuses on technical skills, logical reasoning, and quantitative aptitude
Round 2: Technical interview: A round that focuses on your understanding of the roles and industry
Round 3: Behavioral interview: A round that focuses on teamwork, problem-solving, and adaptability
Round 4: Case interview: A round that assesses subject matter expertise, verbal or written communication, pragmatic thinking, general knowledge, and business acumen
Round 5: Panel interviews: A round of 2-3 in-person interviews with senior managers
Round 6: HR interview: A round for negotiating salary and joining interval
